alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Petersburg; Dinwiddie (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 12:17PM EST until January 14 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River At Matoaca affecting Chesterfield, Dinwiddie and City of Petersburg Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River At Mattoax affecting Chesterfield, Powhatan and Amelia Counties. For the Appomattox Basin...including Farmville, Mattoax, Matoaca... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Appomattox River at Matoaca. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Canal begins to overflow along the right bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EST Friday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM EST Friday was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.6 feet on 03/21/1983. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1230 AM EST.
